MemoryInfobox.description: 'Phidias's clues pointed Kassandra towards the Island of Kythera Island|Kythera. There, she hoped to find the hidden symbol on the Aphrodite's Beauty|Statue of Aphrodite.'
MemoryInfobox.appearance: 'Assassin's Creed: Odyssey – The Lost Tales of Greece'

General_Description: '''The Kytheran Statue''' was a virtual representation of one of [[Kassandra]]'s [[Genetic memory|genetic memories]], relived by [[Layla Hassan]] in 2018 through the [[Animus|Portable Animus HR-8.5]].
Section_Description: Kassandra followed [[Phidias]]'s request and sought out the [[Aphrodite's Beauty|statue]] of the goddess [[Aphrodite]] on [[Kythera Island]].
Section_Dialogue:
Kassandra arrived in Kythera Island, then went east of [[Pilgrim Hill]] and saw Aphrodite's Beauty.
*'''Kassandra:''' ''The sculptor has truly captured the beauty of Aphrodite.''
She went behind it and made a copy of the symbol of a dove behind the statue's back after she climbed it.
*'''Kassandra:''' ''Got it!''
Section_Outcome: Kassandra recovered the symbol on the statue.
Section_Behind_the_scenes: The symbol on the statue is a stylized dove, which is the emblem of Kythera Island, and also the [[bird]] sacred to Aphrodite.
